definitions.definition: to finish doing something that you were doing:
examples: Once I start eating chocolate, I can't stop.

definitions.definition: to not move any more or to make someone or something not move any more:
examples: Stop the car, I want to get out!

definitions.definition: to finish doing something that you do regularly or as a habit:
to pause for a short time while travelling or during an activity:
examples: Does this train stop at Finsbury Park?

definitions.definition: the act of stopping an activity or journey, or a period of time when you stop:
examples: Please remain in your seat until the plane comes to a complete stop.

definitions.definition: a place where vehicles, especially buses, stop in order to allow passengers to get off and on:
short form of  full stop noun
a  plosive  (= consonant that is made by completely stopping the flow of air)
to stop an unpleasant, unwanted activity or habit from continuing:
examples: He used to smoke in bed when I first got to know him, but I soon put a stop to that!
